title: Can we PLEASE stop changing things just to change them?
body:
Riot.

First it was the Boards. We needed new technology, but in this change you damaged the community. Fine, at least we got new tech out of it, right? The boards are... overall more functional.

Then, reworks. So many reworks that messed with what the players loved about the champion. Veigar still only has two abilities, Cass players are **still** waiting for their champion to be added back into the game.

Then, it was changing the "boards." I haven't seen any developments that didn't involve generally wrecking what they just forced everyone to. The organization suggestions make no sense, you're removing GD, so many other things are just _wrong_ with this "upgrade." You opened feedback, we responded. You opened a new thread later, saying you read our feedback. Clearly, you did not, or you did not care for our suggestions. It will be pushed live just as much of a mess as it is now, as with most things.

Yet again, another change -- What the hell is even going on with Fiora's new look? Even if Fiora wasn't a champion up until now, how is that new **mess** even considered passable? Now, go back, and remember that Fiora is a champion, she already has a look, and people like it. You've screwed up two fold here. She wasn't in need of a Visual Update, you're just doing it for fun, and you're destroying her look in the process!

Now, the HUD update. Seriously. The HUD was fine, but the new one is genuinely difficult to use. The proportions are messy, the focus is in the wrong place, key information is hidden in the corners and shrunken to points that it's practically impossible to make out. Yet **another** absolutely needless mess, where Riot is absolutely ignoring the "don't fix what isn't broken" philosophy. [This post covers the topic in far better detail.](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/VMnYeBhO-the-new-hud-is-an-absolutely-terrible-and-counter-intuitive-addition-to-the-game-here-is-why?show=flat&page=10)

When you break things, you're responsible for fixing them. When you break things just to break them, you're at fault.

I love this game, but what you've been doing to it lately is just wrong. I don't know whats going on, but there is some serious cleanup to do here. Get your act together, Riot.

replies.body:
I'm not sure how many reworks you can point to and say "Riot f@cked up". Veigar was pretty good and is still pretty balanced for a champ who can block dashes and 100-0 a champ with a targeted spell, and while most people agree that Cassiopeia's rework was bad she still isn't the shit tier she was and isn't some no counterplay poison mage who can W Q you and just watch your lifebar tick down to nothing. It's hard to come up with a good idea for balancing poison mages, so they did the best that they could for the moment with the one cool mechanic she had. Even Ryze ended up in a really good state.
Fiora's rework was to bring her in line with a lot of other champions with more pronounced visuals. When they changed the hair and face they discovered that they'd gone too far and hit a nerve with the community, and they've already started changing her splash art.
The HUD is mostly a matter of opinion and an aversion to change. Most people will get used to it quickly, the same way they got used to the old HUD when they started playing. I sincerely hope they will add more customization later, but the new HUD is still an improvement with new features, overall better aesthetics and more open space by moving things to focus points on the map.

**Tristana** - Removed from the game.
**Cassiopeia** - Rework accomplished nothing and at the end of the day was just a HUGE damage nerf.
**Zilean** - Removed from the game.
**Veigar** - Severely gutted, needed multiple changes to become even half as good as before.
**Mordekaiser** - Was he even reworked?
**Soraka** - Became more obnoxious than before.
**Nidalee** - don't even get me started here. Rework solved none of her problems, but made her even bigger cancer than she ever was.

Here. Seven reworks off the top of my head.

Tristana - No longer removes other champions from the game with two buttons
Cassiopeia - Yeah, it's pretty bad
Zilean - Can no longer instantly Q W Q for half the opponent's health
Veigar - Blocks dashes, can't instantly stun the entire enemy team with E and 100 - 0 half of them with one W cast
Mordekaiser - I don't even think so
Soraka - No longer spams Starcall to shred an entire team's magic resist, can heal better which is her entire identity
Nidalee - Don't even remember her, current presence is just so strong

They didn't become competitive picks, but most of these reworks added interesting mechanics and extra strength as a trade off for killing enemies with two buttons. Now it takes some semblance of skill to do well on these champions, juggling Soraka's heals, predicting Veigar's cage, landing Zilean's bombs. Maybe they became less strong, but they became more balanced.
Wanna go back to the days when AP Tristana one shot any other midlaner post-6?
Wanna go back to the days when Soraka could shit on every other melee mid laner?
I thought so.

They KILLED Zilean. The only thing anyone notices is that he can't just get a Q W Q off. They also reduced his E from 5 seconds to 2.5 sec............HALF!? His Q is also absurdly absurdly bugged. If you literally cast it in the exact same location, 30% of the time it will not trigger. If you cast it twice on a unit/champion who isn't moving but suddenly moves at the very end of the second one landing, it will not attach. They made him unplayable, completely. He is so buggy it hurts. It's no longer about skill, it's becoming about luck.

Soraka's Kit has only recently turned into "pure healing". When she was first created, Sona actually had much better healing. But Soraka was the one who could heal **everyone **and restore mana. She used to give passive MR and reduce enemy MR. She can't reduce resistances now, she doesn't give her team any, nor can she regen mana. They've tunneled her into a pocket she must fit into, which is a shame because I was in love with the first.

Also the Soraka you're referring to was her **FIRST** rework. Her Q originally had MISERABLE damage. They buffed it in season 2 because they wanted her to be an aggressive support instead of a passive one. Morello has always disliked Soraka, so he pushed for her to be more bruiser. And then because of that they removed her self target E, her mana restore, her MR passive, and her MR shred........

They didn't fix the problem, they just removed the problem champion from the metagame entirely.

Lets not pretend that making Nidalee stronger and more versatile was a good decision. It just made her dominate even roles she wasn't picked in before.

In return for using skillshots (and this applies to Ryze too) Veigar and Zilean both got range upgrades.
Veigar's E got a range upgrade, and the time it takes to appear means you need to use it in situations such as A) your team gets a pick but the enemy team is coming in fast. Screw them, they can't get around that big ass Event Horizon, and if they try they're screwed. B) Hecarim, Malphite, Vi coming in to wreck your carry? Well, they're coming in alone this time, 'cause they're team is way over there beyond the Event Horizon. C) Allied cc going down? Well, its not like we were gonna let the enemy team move or anything. Get in the Event Horizon.
You see how that works? It's not a skill you use to line up your burst anymore. It's a skill that says "I have control of this teamfight, and you can't stop me." That's removing toxic gameplay while keeping what the ability should have been.
Zilean's Q has an enormous stun which works so well when you have someone like Amumu or Sejuani on your team. If I remember correctly, his speed boost and ultimate also got buffs. Seriously, he can steamroll a team so hard late game.
So what if these guys aren't competitive picks anymore? I don't give a damn about what's going on in the lcs when I can have fun in Normals/Ranked, unafraid of "press this button to kill" champions. If there are better picks for the pros, so be it.
P.S. Veigar is my go-to midlaner since the rework. Zilean is my go-to support. So I may be a bit biased.

Veigar's E got a 50 range increase. Barely anything, especially considering they tripled the amount of time it takes to appear.

Your team gets a pick -- you've already won the fight.  Screw them, they'll get from one end of the event horizon and out the other by the time it drops. Every other zone mage in the game could toss something in there to slow the enemy down, too. It'd probably work better too.

Any of those three coming in to wreck your carry? They aren't coming in alone, the enemy team can **walk around the event horizon, or even through it in many cases.** Again, other champions have better zoning skills anyways.

Allied CC going down? Well. This is the ONLY use of Event Horizon in the game. Shame that it's required for his W to work, too. Guess you can only use 2/4 of your abilities (one of which is a long CD ultimate) until an ally comes along and hard CCs an enemy champion for you!

Its not a skill you can use at all, unless other champions do all the work for you. That is a bad skill. Its only applications are follow ups. I don't know why this is a thing, it makes the champion useless until teamfights, and even during teamfights he has to waddle into killing-range to do anything anyways!
The enemy has to actually screw up for you to use more than half of your kit. That is just straight up awful.

Now Zilean. Zilean is a mess. His only damage skill, his CC, and half of his W is all wrapped up in his Q. His Q that he has to land **twice** on the same person to stun them. His Q is too slow to land once, let alone twice. Even when the enemy is slowed by your E, they can still dodge your Q because mobility skills are a thing thrown onto almost every champion in the game anymore.
His speedboost and ultimate both got NERFS. His speedboost is no longer capable of making you permanently faster, and his ultimate is no longer affected whatsoever by his W. All of these changes combined made him actual trash.

They aren't competitive picks, they aren't standard picks. Are you actually suggesting that game balance doesn't matter because you're not a pro? Maybe to you, for whatever reason. The fact that I can't play my favorite champions without **knowing** that without a doubt there is a better champion for the job, that will guarantee me at least another 10% winrate, without the stress of farming for 40-50 minutes to be useful, capable of making plays by myself in ranked SOLOque?

Yeah. They ruined those champions.
I'm sorry for your loss. What a shame you can't make use of a fun champion.

I feel like the HUD has upgraded at-a-glance understanding. You look in the bottom right hand corner and BAM! there's your creep score, minimap, teammate status, etc. You open up tab and BAM! there's everything they had before and more and you can customize the champion order too. You look down to your champion stats and you know what that's still slightly hard to read but it's no harder to read than the icons they had before and as soon as we get used to them it'll be just as natural. The problem is that they never really finish what work needs to be done in order to make all of these champion's reworks playable.  Reworks such as Zilean's, Veigar's, and Cassiopeia's are all considered failures.  They added little to nothing to the character while removing something their players enjoyed.  Zilean was reworked for simply being toxic, Veigar because of his stun as a support, and Cassiopeia for reasons I don't know.  Coming up ideas for fixing these champions wouldn't be too difficult, it's implementation and reiteration that is hard.  I could easily come up with ideas for each of these champions to spice them up, make them less boring, and allow them to be viable but not toxic.  Examples:

Veigar: Give abilities extra effects when shot into his E.  Q could bounce off the walls, W could be aimed during its flight (paint a path for it?), and his R could deal a big burst of AOE magic damage if it kills the target.

Zilean: Needs a new passive.  Q also needs to have a priority for targets it hits rather than closest thing (Champions > Minions > Monsters?).

Cassiopeia: There's a whole mess of stuff wrong with her machine gun E and her poisons doing little to nothing.  Right now her and Azir occupy very similar niches (which isn't good imo).  She should be focused around her poisons and debuffing her opponent rather than Q E E E E Q E E E E Q.

I think what they're doing is a good thing. If they were to leave the game exactly as is you and everyone else would be sitting around on the forums saying,"Why haven't we gotten any big changes we've been waiting for".
